# separatesColumns

**Instance Property**

A Boolean that indicates whether columns are separated by bezeled borders.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var separatesColumns: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the browser’s columns are separated by bezeled borders.

This value is ignored if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBrowser/isTitled] does not return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Configuring Browsers

- **reusesColumns**: A Boolean that indicates whether the browser reuses matrix objects after their columns are unloaded.
- **maxVisibleColumns**: The maximum number of visible columns.
- **autohidesScroller**: A Boolean that indicates whether the browser automatically hides its scroller.
- **backgroundColor**: The browser’s background color.
- **minColumnWidth**: The minimum column width, in pixels.
- **takesTitleFromPreviousColumn**: A Boolean that indicates whether a column takes its title from the selected cell in the previous column.
- **tile()**: Adjusts the various subviews of the browser—scrollers, columns, titles, and so on—without redrawing.
- **delegate**: The browser’s delegate.
